N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 69.5 - Standards for front crossing arm

State Regulations

The front crossing arm shall be made of any durable
material covered with a yellow or white reflective material. The front crossing
arm shall be attached to the front bumper of the vehicle hinged from the
vehicle's right side at a height of 16-20" up from the ground. It must be
extended in conjunction with the required caution arm as described in section
69.2
of this Part. When extended
outward in front of the vehicle, the front crossing arm shall extend
approximately 4 to 6 feet parallel to the ground to prohibit person(s) from
being too close to the vehicle as they prepare to cross the road. When the
front crossing arm is retracted against the front of the vehicle it shall not
extend past the width of the vehicle on the driver's left
side. Notes
